semantic_identifier: 51: feat: Backend job + endpoint for cross-channel positioning messaging consistency audit

sections.text:
## Description

Implements a scheduled backend audit that evaluates messaging consistency across channels (website copy, sales deck snippets, email templates) against the latest approved positioning recommendations for the same segment.

Key changes:
- Adds a new audit job that:
  - Fetches the latest approved positioning recommendations per segment.
  - Pulls current messaging assets per channel/segment.
  - Normalizes content and compares against recommended value props, differentiators, and proof points.
  - Computes a per-channel divergence score (missing items + altered items) and includes a lightweight breakdown by category.
- Persists time-series audit results (segment, channel, score, missing/altered lists, timestamps) to support trend tracking.
- Exposes an internal read-only endpoint to query recent/flagged inconsistencies by segment/channel and threshold (intended for follow-on UI/alerting work).
- Adds structured logging for each audit run (run id, counts, highest divergence) to aid debugging/monitoring.

Operational notes:
- Job can be run on-demand (manual trigger) and via scheduler; safe to re-run (writes a new point-in-time record per run).
- Endpoint is internal-only; no user-facing UI changes included in this PR.
- Default divergence threshold is configurable via env/config to tune sensitivity without code changes.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
